title.narrative: Scaling Up Nutrition Technical Assistance ( SUN TA)

description.narrative: (Zambia): .The Scaling Up Nutrition Technical Assistance (SUN TA) mechanism works through a cross-ministry and multi-donor mechanism towards the reduction of stunting among children under age two in 13 districts. SUN TA focuses on delivering 1) crop diversification to address dietary diversity among women and children; 2) minimally-acceptable diets for children under two years; 3) health-seeking behaviors including voluntary family planning, early childhood development and treatment of childhood illnesses; 4) increased access to safe drinking water and improved sanitation; 5) a social and behavior change approach to increase uptake of priority nutrition practices; 6) training on the importance of eating a nutritious diet during pregnancy and lactation; and 7) establish District and Nutrition Coordinating Committees (DNCCs) and Ward Nutrition Coordination Committees (WNCCs) as a delivery channel for all nutrition related activities, thereby ensuring the sustainability of activities after close-out. The FY 2020 funding will support households with pregnant and lactating women with nutrition-specific, health and family planning messages, and hygiene-promotion activities. The mechanism includes training District and Village Water Sanitation Hygiene and Community Led Total Sanitation champions to improve sanitation and access to safe water. SUN TA will establish DNCCs and WNCCs as part of the National Food and Nutrition Commission organizational structure in the districts where these structures do not exist. Other activities include support to the implementation of adaptive management to respond to studies being conducted by the SUN Learning and Evaluation mechanism. Under USAID's CDCS, the mechanism will support Development Objective 3: Capacity of Zambia's Government, Citizens and Private Sector Increased to Improve Health Outcomes and Meet Critical Needs of Vulnerable Populations... ..
